title: serif font
content:
shame on me...I am not able to identify this font.  
Someone can blow me the answer?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [RESY.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023211/http:/typophile.com/files/RESY.jpg) | 151.79 KB |
author: wonderfulgreg

comments.content:
mmmhh..Big Caslon is very similar but too fat.

I think it's a Caslon but which one ?

[http://imagesgonerogue.com/2010/05/raquel-zimmermann-vp1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023211/http:/imagesgonerogue.com/2010/05/raquel-zimmermann-vp1.jpg "http://imagesgonerogue.com/2010/05/raquel-zimmermann-vp1.jpg")

This bigger sample reminds me of [Industria](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023211/http:/typophile.com/node/77367). So if it comes from Industrie Magazine, that should be it.  
Quoted from this previous discussion.

> This is the house font of Saturday Group, created for Industrie magazine. It's a custom version based on a Big Caslon with a modern twist in it. So far, it has 4 cuts: Medium, Light, Light Italic and Sans (not used yet). Thanks for your interest.
